results.title: Light play: black-white-gray = Ein lightspiel: scwarz-weiss-grau
results.brief_description: Moholy-Nagy, an exponent of modern design in architecture, painting, theatre and typography, illustrates the forms and relationships of his constructivist art. Constructions of steel, glass and wire, including the artist’s light-space modulator, move, merge and dissolve to produce a world of interrelated shapes and patterns. Surface textures, spatial tensions and shadows are combined with the resources of the film cameras - super- impositions, positive-negative contrasts and trick effects to produce rhythms in light, shade, space and movement.

results.title: Before production begins
results.brief_description: The story of the birth of a new Holden car, from an artist’s conception, through the modelling of small and full scale models, to the making of the first prototype model. From the hundreds of scale drawings, skilled craftsmen create by hand, the hundreds of engine and body components of the prototype. Laboratory and road tests of components and the completed prototype ensue that every section of the car conforms to rigid engineering specifications. Only after all this preliminary work can mass production begin on a new model Holden car.

results.title: 1999, Charli XCX & Troye Sivan
results.credit_line:
Charli XCX & Troye Sivan

Creative Direction: WP&A

Executive Producer: Ryen Bartlett

Warner Music Group
results.brief_description:
The official music video for Charli XCX & Troye Sivan - “1999”.

Taken from the third studio album Charli, released in 2019. Charli featured the singles “1999”, “Blame It On Your Love”, “Gone” and “White Mercedes.”

constellations_other.name: Faking History (War Dress PLACEHOLDER)
constellations_other.description: The Great takes a creative approach to its historical characters and settings that is mirrored in its costumes - this war dress might have a classic silhouette, but the grimy pearlescent fabric and striking oxblood detailing is completely modern. Faking history is a time-honoured tradition in film, from historical fiction to propaganda.

constellations_other.name: Beyond the game industry (PLACEHOLDER)
constellations_other.description: While the game industry garners a lot of publicity, digital games have long been created outside the official industry, and the social and cultural significance of games has always exceeded official channels.

results.title: Project Archive
results.brief_description: The project archive of Brisbane programmer, Nick Marentes, tells the story behind the creation of each of his homebrew games, as well as his hopes and dreams of becoming a millionaire. Marentes wrote games for the Tandy range of computers, beginning with the TRS-80.

results.title: Walt Disney Movie Viewer Cartridge [Snow White]
results.brief_description:
Walt Disney Movie Viewer
The first Movie Viewer was made in the USA in 1973 by Fisher Price. The British version was made by the Mettoy company. The viewer used Super 8 film and the actual clips were short pieces from real cartoon films. No technology was required to operate the viewer, not even batteries. The hand crank enabled the operator to view the film at any speed with the ability to go forwards or backwards at will.
